cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 280 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to accelerate toward the north-northeast, make landfall in Florida’s Big Bend Thursday night, then sweep northeastward across south-central Georgia and the Carolinas before emerging off the Mid-Atlantic coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast between Suwannee River and Mexico Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: Marineland, FL northward to South Santee River, SC (includes entire Georgia coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Suwannee River to Mexico Beach, FL (hurricane); Anclote River to Destin, FL (tropical-storm)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida–Georgia line northward through coastal Georgia and the Carolinas to Cape Fear
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–50 mph with higher gusts) possible late Friday into early Saturday as the center passes just inland.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft surge possible along the Georgia coast, including the Savannah River entrance.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher totals could produce flash flooding in the Savannah area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible Friday into Friday night across southeast Georgia.
